intro: Tounatea pilulifera, commonly known as the pilule tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant produces small, round fruits that resemble pills, hence its common name. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. The leaves are simple, opposite, and have a glossy surface, contributing to its ornamental value.
